reallly tough to get to dc but you can walk down highway 29.

Redding can be frustrating, and rides from Cypress Avenue can take awhile, but you'll get a ride eventually. This exit features several gas stations, fast food outlets, and lots of room to pull over, and long distance rides from this spot are likely.
Westbound. A pretty crap spot, overall. I waited all day & had no ride offers. Spokane is damn difficult to get out of.
Going I-74E, I stood in the middle by the left turn lane because the cars stop there for the red light.  Be prepared to wait a while.

Next to a police station, they didn't bother me, but I wouldn't recommend it.  Also, no one is going to Indiana, they are all just getting around the city, so it is pretty pointless if you are trying to go long distances.
Well It's fine if you're just trying to go skiing... Otherwise you should go to Portland before heading south.

Going south? Stand here!  There's a good place for cars to pull off the road.  They're usually going pretty slow. Most of the traffic during the winter is heading to the ski resorts on Mount Hood.  During the summer people will be driving farther.

Southbound: You'll probably get thrown out of this gas station, and you'll probably have to walk. Unfortunately, the 101 is curbed and high-speed with no pull-over spaces for miles. Don't end up here.
Love's Truck Stop here. Employees were friendly even with my big backpack. Highway entrance ramps both wide (east and west) and easy to hitchhike.

Tried for over 3 hours to get out of Coos Bay. Was getting pretty sketchy and started to get hassled by hobos. Got picked up by pure luck after dark and taken to Bandon. If you can, avoid stopping in this town too late in the day.

Gas stations in Oregon are usually no good, as they all have pump-attendants, who can be very grumpy and call the police on you. Don't bother. I'd recommend catching a bus out of Brookings, as it's a long walk to any hitching spots.
An ok spot, but a long, expensive bus ride from the bay and a long walk from the bus stop. Next time I'll try hitching in town.

It could have been the time of day, but I thumbed for about 5 hours while walking north on the 101.  I saw so many hippie VW Buses and no one picked me up!  So I camped in the Redwoods and got a ride the next morning close to "N. Bank Road" at the bridge about 3km north of here.  Check that thumb ...
Not the best spot to go south to Moscow/Pullman, but perhaps it was the time of day ... 9pm

At 11pm I ended up asking every single driver at this gas station if they were going south, most said no.  Finally I landed a ride south ... funny because the driver drove really fast and passed all those liars that told me they weren't driving south!!
It was probably the time of day I hitched, but I didn't have much luck trying to hitch north from here...  instead I walked onto the interstate and thumbed

HH to harrisburg.
The place was not too good since it was already on a speedway (two lanes). Eventually after 40 mins and right before a big shower rain a police car picked me up. The officer was nice and took me a good piece of the way to Harrisburg.

(In case police car comes dont run away to not provoke suspicion and just ask for a right playing as if it was the most normal thing to do. Worked here.
Took about 2 or 3 hours to get a ride to Vegas ... seems like most people entering the freeway here are going that far (lots of Nevada plates)

Lots of cars are particular times of the day .... most seems like local traffic.  Not much space to stop, but there is a stoplight that might be able to help if you wanted to ask the drivers directly.  I wouldn't recommend this spot, but I wouldn't say it's senseless.

People are driving too fast to feel comfortable hitchhiking and too many ways. Not a nice spot.

Drew gave me a ride all the way to Whitefish, telling me about his theories and life stories. He offered to host me if I couldn't get a ride.
I ended up at his place where he cooked me dinner, played guitar as I was eating and had great convo all along the night.

Hitchhiked while walking towards the edge of the city. Got a quick ride from a mom bringing her son to work at Broadwater. 
She talked a lot and he didn't at all.

Shoulder on Euclid Ave is good, try to get dropped at one of the gas stations there to get a ride more easily I guess.

Gas station with few people stopping and even fewer car heading north on 20, easy to hitchhike both at the same time. 

I received $12 in total from people going to the drive-thru. People were quite nice and friendly, just hard to get a ride.

A girl who passed me when I started came back to give me a ride as she was about to take one herself to chill from her studies.

Lots of fun and giggles with Madi, almost convinced her to go on an adventure all the way to the Canadian border.
Instea

Great shoulder, but almost no traffic. 
Exit that really exist for the casino.
As I was to leave and get my chance on US 91, a mexican woman stopped.
Losing track of time playing at the casino, she got late for her job as she was now broke. She was nice and drop me where it was most convenient for her.
despite high traffic and wide shoulder, couldnt get a ride for a while - was planning to go south but as the sun set i decided to cut losses and get a ride back to santa cruz

Got dropped there because was at the outside of Roosevelt. 
Not many people stopping there and traffic was too fast without any shoulder to properly pull over.

I got lucky and a Native man who passed me came back and give me a ride all the way to Salt Lake City. 
Small discussion but deep about travels and what we've been through life.
Mostly listen to music and enjoyed the scenery

Main road in the middle of town. Little traffic, manageable to ask at the gas station and panhandle on the side of the road.

People were okay, just not going West.

Got a ride from Courtney, a woman in her thirties who saw me prior. She offered me a ride first to Craig, and then said she had enough time to push all the way to Maybell, the last tiny town before 70 miles of nothingness except desert and amazing views. 

On the way, we dropped some furniture at her apartment and picked up on

After late lunch, decided spontaneously to hitchhike to reach the Strawberry Hot Springs as they've been highly recommended to me multiple times.

It was already dark and was walking with a  sign and my headlamp on. 

An old woman saw me from her barn and drove top me, scared I was about to backpack by night in the cold and potentially try to sleep outside. After telling her the situation, she ended giving me a short ride to increase my chances to get a car going all the way to the Hot Sprin

Good shoulder but little traffic and some people giving mean looks.

Got finally a ride by two young guys from one of the Dakotas. They were pretty fun.

They agreed to get out of the I-70 and drop me a bit further on the highway to get my next ride more easily.

Great place with enough traffic and good shoulder, but only had smiles and hand gestures from driver.

First 30 minutes thumb only, then drew a  sign saying 'Denver'.

End up calling a cab, & a car finally pulled over when it arrived...

Hitchhiked directly on the highway.

Got a ride from two Oregon men on their way to Amarillo.
Nice and willing to help.

Crazy car, none had driver licenses, were trying to find a solution to get their friend out of jail for detaining meth.

Dropped me in Amarillo as they were still running errands in town but offered me to pick me up and drive me further West when they would head that direction if I haven't found another ride at that point.

Lots of traffic, but no one stopped.

Got to talk with a truck driver, but he eventually didn't want to take the risk of getting a passenger.

An old man stopped just to advise me to walk along the highway and panhandle at the same time, that's how they used to do at his time.

A few minutes after, a car pulled over. He already passed me and came back to pick me up. First, he offered to drive me all the way to Bowie, before offering me to go the furthest I wanted, as long as he was back in

Empty place. Got lucky on that one to have such a short wait.

A retired man going home. He used to pick up hitchhikers to sermon them. 
He was amazed by my trip stories and keep telling me it will blow her wife's mind when he will tell her about it.
Nice guy. And nice mustache.

On the highway shoulder, large and plenty of room to stop. Low traffic.
Cops passed by without stopping.

A man in a pick-up pulled over. Wasn't really interested in chatting. Told me if I was still in Gray the day after, he could bring me all the way to Lake Charles. I don't know how serious he was about it.

Lots of traffic, but not really giving me any attention.

A first car stopped but didn't give me a ride, just rubbish talk. 

Local end up giving me a ride and drove a few more miles to drop me after I-310 exit so I could have more chances with traffic.
He told me about the New Orleans of his youth and his opinions about national politics.

Very nice locals I met in a bar gave me a place to stay as they told me the police could be nasty on the island. 
Forbidden to spend the night there if you don't have a property.

Got in touch with my driver online the night before, thanks to one of my previous driver who end up fixing her car.
She joined me where I was to spend the night & we head to nola together the next morning

No real shoulder on the whole Boulevard. Good traffic, but coming by fast waves.

A nice couple who passed me a first time came back to get me. As we were talking, they end up always keeping further where they'll drop me, giving me a nice long ride and the chance to get on time the ferry !

Gas station quite empty, no real shoulder to stop.

Got a ride from a Milton local who lived half his life on the street. Helping everyone who needs it since. Nice person

Dropped here by my hosts heading North, while I was going West. 

Other panhandlers asking for money in the area.

Got a ride from a young man going to work in Jacksonville. Nonetheless, he drove me the most west he could, taking even the risk to arrive late to his shift.

He told me about the dreadful work conditions and management in a poultry farming factory.

Great shoulder but little traffic.

I suspect most people enter the highway at exits further west.

Finally have a Mexican man on his way home, withwhom I could talk largely about his culture and his work experience in the US. Offered to drop me at my CS host in Gainesville and gave me money at the end of the ride.

Little traffic and no one stopped before my driver did.

He lived in California and hooked me up with some of his friends for my further rides there. Keep going on a few miles to drop me where I asked him to.

Was getting high on the road, shouldn't have gotten into the car, but I was tired of waiting and being on the road on Christmas day, I wished to move fast.

Some traffic, but big ramp with too many ways and people driving already very fast. 

Accepted the first car stopping, hoping I could get to a better spot.

It ended up being a young local who backed up to reach me and gave me a ride to the next exit.
Sweet and hopeful man.

Bad spot, no one seems to take care of me, even if great shoulder. Might be because I was there too late in the afternoon.
I ended up accepting a ride to Orlando to get there a Greyhound to Tampa, to not get stucked in Ocala for the night.

Driver was an old Florida man who started the ride by telling me how Muslims were replacing people in the area. End up telling me about his past and his religious beliefs. 
Despite divergent opinions, he was very nice and accepted to do a small detour to

Walked there hoping to get the traffic leaving Walmart & heading South. Great shoulder for cars to stop, but not as much traffic expected on FL19...

Finally got a ride from a man going home to Ocala who dropped me where it was for him a safe place in the destination city and a good place to keep heading South.

Lots of truck but few drivers. 
No interaction with the gas station employees.

Got a ride with a man, on his way home from work.
He accepted to take a detour through Michaux State Forest to get a nicer scenery than on the Interstate (recommended)

Turkey Hill Gas Station. 
Not lots of people stopping by, mostly locals.

End up having a short to go further on I-81 to Middlesex to a truck stop.

Driver was a Pastor, tried to convince me to read the book of Jon and gave me his phone unmber a tthe end in any case

Gave up after two hours waiting there, as sun sets. Trying to head West towards Harrisburg. 

Has a large shoulder and good traffic, but the spot is a bit downhill from the last traffic lights and drivers can't see you before last second
Mexican couple picked me up. Real nice people. If you run into them, treat them well please.
Not a good place to stop, I got lucky with a ride but there's little to no traffic and almost no room to stop
Got picked up by an angel who took us all the way to Savannah. Almost no traffic going thru here

not a lot of space to pull over, low visibility, and the town seemed quite touristy and uppity. I only got a ride because an uber driver saw me a few times while I was waiting and circled around to get me after they were done driving for the day to help me out. They ended up enjoying the ride a lot and took me all the way to my final destination over 16 hours of driving, eating, and walking around the beaches along the coast
easily my most enjoyable ride yet, but I doubt it's replicable lol

the spot is pretty bad because it's a short ramp with a large turn in it with no where for drivers to pull over. When I put my bag on, I got a ride pretty quickly since someone felt comfortable stopping traffic for a few seconds (vs having to wait for me to get my bag)
Pretty good spot and seems like most of the cars are going towards i95, plenty of room to pull over. Guess we just had bad luck and weren't able to get a ride before dark
Lots of traffic but little shoulder. Had a few ppl stop but they were going the wrong way. Ended up taking the Amtrak rest of way to Boston

Not entirely sure about drop off point. Waited a long time thumming on entrance ramp, no rides. Also no luck asking at gas stations. Finaly was dumb and started walking down interstate at 2am. Eventualy did get picked up by a trucker.
Lot of state troopers around here. One took me to Kimball Junction.

Very long wait at this desolate onramp. Finally got a guy going towards Seward who offered to take me to the nearby truck rest area. This rest area was quite deserted and I ended up walking a few miles to get to a better spot.

Cop stopped, said I can't walk on the turnpike, then drove me down to a gas station way far south of 88. Ended up hitching US route 30 for awhile which was probably slower but has some cute little towns and some fun locals.

Pueblo is a city I'll do my best to avoid on future hitchhiking trips. Everyone seems guarded. A construction guy eventually stopped just off work, gave me some weed, and ferried me to the edge of town. There are nice people everywhere.
Not a great spot, eventually a lady came by and took pity and took me to the edge of town.
Love's Truck stop. Mostly people going South! I waited a long time for a ride north, got it with a trucker to Pueblo CO
Most people just yell at you
Not a lot of cars taking the north onramp here. Would've gone to the other onramp in town, but on streetview it didn't seem like a good spot.

A great spot from a technical front. Plenty of visibility, plenty of cars, safe spot to stand, lots of room to pull over. I was hitchhiking with a bicycle, so I understand that it takes a while, but there were TONS of pickups trucks with empty truck beds and it still took almost two hours. Plenty of strange looks and a couple middle fingers later, I eventually got a ride.
Too busy for people to notice despite plenty of room to pull off. Got lots of mean looks and a few middle fingers
The spot sucks but sometimes that doesn't matter. We got a lift from a grandma in a Tesla up to the turnpike.
Parkway police pulled over at the same time as our ride. Told us not to walk on the parkway but he let us all go on our way. Laughed about it later. Lots of cops in NJ

Pretty bad spot altogether. Felt weird about trying to hitch up I-87 with the tollway situation so we tried 9W. Got picked up by a couple of girls who were headed up I-87 anyways and took us to New Paltz. Ended up jamming a little bit and walking around town.
Slow spot. Got a ride but just to the junction.
A couple of 16 year olds picked us up. Very country. Took the back way to Union with lots of bumps, hurtling around corners and yelling at neighbors for some reason.
Slow hitchhiking in this part of West Virginia. All locals. They seemed a little perplexed but nice enough.
Even the small towns can take a long time to walk across. Finally got a ride to the breakaway point.
It's those essential rides to the edge of town.
Short ride out of town from a lady who wasn't doing anything.
Another lucky lift way out of town. Past the White River bridge because the woman who picked us up didn't want us walking over the bridge.
Got extremely lucky catching a guy's attention at a red light. He offered to take us up the road.
25's. Had to hitch from the left side of the road bcz there is no right shoulder. But there is space to pull over on the left.

2guys, 20's. Heading north, walked along the highway from Rd 178 interchange. There is room to stop but not many cars and the go pretty quick. 
We better have stayed on the main highway coming from Mojave.
Nobody stopped, eventually this guy showed up after buying something at the store nearby and brought us to Beaumont
Good space to pull over with god visibility but people dont really stop, pretty slow traffic too
Long waiting time with calm continuous traffic, space to pull over good

One day without any car because of the rain. People don't pickup. Local cop told us it's illegal to hitchhike in Alabama, so make sure they don't see you. The sheriff seems to do not care. Finally picked up in the back of another truck, direct ride to the interstate
barely alive. lots of businesses who cannot pick you up, but if you find someone, people usually kind and ready to share

Might have just been unlucky but we were on the side of the road for 5 hours, maybe more. State Trooper pulled over to check on us and apologize that they aren't allowed to pick up hitchhikers anymore. Somewhere on Hitchhike someone mentions that Texans will more likely give you money than a ride. This was true in our experience. We stopped in the diner across the street for lunch and people were very helpful but no rides. Eventually a guy picked us up going all the way to Childress.
Lots of traffic but not a lot of rides. Finally  got lucky and a guy took us past Alamosa, to Blanca after we helped him get a four wheeler into his pickup bed.
Pretty bad spot, but we got lucky when a cop pulled over and told us hitchhiking was illegal. Gave us a ride to the state line.

Not good, but maybe the best spot if you are stuck in the middle of Spokane. Better option might be to take busses all the way to Liberty Park. Woman who picked us up bought us 4 joints and 2 carts. Road magic. Made the wait kind of worth it.
Seems like it would be a good spot on paper but took forever for some reason going east
Lots of people and place to stop dunno why people wouldn't take it

Most people go to nearby location, I was trying for the grand canyon. Moved here after trying the intersection with Pratt street during an hour (I wanted to avoid all the people just going to the dollar store)

Yes. I got a ride to Napoleon from here. But I was there and nearby for almost 10 fckn hours. I was staying in 5 different spots. And nothing. The best to get out from there: ask people directly at a gas station, make a sign and seat nearby a gas station so people will see you and stay on exit of gas station and McDonald, witch helped me. But if you can avoid - do that. That's not worth it. But Woodburn is a really good place and strong community. Was walking on a street and looking for a place
Too long, too many cars, but there is nothing else unfortunetly
Had to wait quite a while but the tree here provides shade. Didn't get a lift very far
Not a great spot. Waiting for a long time but eventually picked up. Main bonus is traffic building up

Bad spot - Rockwall is the richest county in Texas and it shows. Loads of spotless dodge rams moving too fast to slow down. Traffic is really bad which makes things a bit easier, but better to wait on the interstate than the ramp as the frontage roads very fast and mainly local traffic
Pretty long wait, kinda fancy area and heckled quite a bit
Not a great spot, made to move along from the welcome centre by security, and only got picked up due to traffic. Really nice Ukrainian guy let me hop in and took me all the way to Nashville though

Went to this on ramp late, hitching south, but still bright out. There is a TA and airport right next to it but not as much traffic as you'd expect. Plenty of room to pull over and time to see you, but I was at that spot for almost 2 hours and didn't have anyone stop. Tried again the next morning for an hour but experienced even less traffic. You'll have better luck flying directly at the TA's. The cops won't mess with you here though, had multiple drive past without saying anything, and one eve
Cop told me it was illegal to hitch. Allowed me to walk with my thumb out tho…

in theory its a good spot to go north from. big shoulder, slowish traffic. took hours though. i didn't ask at the gas station, maybe that would've been quicker. there is a tesla charging spot there, but they weren't too friendly

It was pretty late in the day but people were pretty reluctant to pick me up. One guy even pulled off onto the shoulder and tried to shoot rocks at me.

I ended up taking the city bus out to the truckstops out at Troutdale.

Portland seems like a bit of a mess. I'm glad I'm just passing through.
People are going really fast, well, it’s the highway…

People here suck. There is plenty of room for vehicles to pull off, but there isn't much traffic and people here are just... Filled with hate.

They honked, rolled coal, revved their engines, screamed out their windows, and they even bore their teeth at me. These people are savages.

These people don't even know me. Man, What is wrong with these people?!?!?

This spot is not recommended...

This exit is all Jersey barrier. There is a little bit of a "shoulder" but it doesn't offer any room to pull off. You may have luck at the nearby Petro truck stop, but if you're on foot don't bother coming out this far.
So many cars, all passed by real slow to gawk at me until i was about to give up. No shade.
There is a fair bit of traffic, but folks here seem a little snooty. It doesn't mean you can't get lucky, but I didn't.
Traffic is fast. Plenty of room to pull over but it took me a long time to find someone who stopped.

Waiter for 4 hours and nobody stopped. Could be due the the fact that at the beginning of the entrance ramp there is a  homeless camp under the viaduct, so drivers automatically think one is a begeer/panhandler

There's limited shoulder on the interstate on-ramps going down most of 95 in Connecticut, but all the on-ramps in Norwalk are screwy. 

Was stopped by a state trooper a ways back for "Improper use of the highway" for being on an on-ramp. (Can't actually find anything about this specific term or like terms via Google). Although I didn't receive a ticket, I was ordered to move to the street leading up to the on-ramp.

You can ride on the train to New York City from as far back as New Haven for nin

My friend and I got stuck here for 24 hours, HOWEVER, we split up and spanged at two different gas stations and made 231$ in an hour together. The people are nice; I should note we were a male/male duo. Get talking to the folk in Stafford if you get stuck, they're quite nice.
Managed to get a ride on the onramp here south to eugene in about an hour
Florence is largely a retirement town. Very difficult to catch a ride here. Took us three hours to get out. Some decent spots along the 101 in town though.
Can confirm with previous poster - the owners kick you out and threaten to call the police.
Very large rest stop with trucks.  A lady will kick you out if you ask "her drivers" for a lift, but if that happens, its still good to stand by the exit with a sign.
Yeah going south this sucks. Going North is doable though

I’ve never before in my life waited 6 hours without anyone even stopping.  I figured it was a good spot since there is a wide shoulder and a lot of traffic.  They told me hitching in VT was easy hahaha
sounds like our experience.
Seriously, what is wrong with you Americans? People drove by and pulled up their windows, shouted at us, threatened us with their damn guns. DO NOT GO THERE.
Interstate ramp at the far north of LA. Feels like a really poor neighbourhood. People are scared and rude.
Horrible spot but I got lucky when a Mexican guy in a work van pulled across the lanes of construction to come save me.
Horrible spot but I got lucky when a Mexican guy in a work van pulled across the lanes of construction to come save me.
Cops will tell you to stop, same in Jackson

Headed east. A really bad location. NO traffic, and also traffic coming in at two different places. I'm pretty sure I got a pity lift. Definitely avoid hitching here if possible.

(female, 20s)
Terrible place to get dropped off. Only 1 car going west / 30 minutes. best bet is to make the trek back to LaCrescent.

Tried for three days going west. On ramp's fucked, most of the traffic at this truck stop is locals, according to the people working at the truck stop. They also have a short fuse, and will kick you out after a day, meaning they don't want you sitting on their property period. Nice camping and a good bridge by the tracks, at least.
If you're passing through on a train,. do not get off here. Terrible, terrible hitching on both exits. Took four days to get a ride west, practically unheard of in Montana.

I was going to try hitchhiking here but there were 2 problems.  First, the traffic is ridiculous and it is super hard to cross the street without getting hit.  Second, even if you are on the correct side of the road to hitch west they don't cut down any of the grass or plants so you would have to walk through tons of brush right on the side of the highway in order to get to the on-ramp.  I wouldn't even try it here.
bad place

hopi travel plaza- truck stop

BAD PLACE
wait 1 and half day
Trying to go north to the next town on the interstate. Nearly an 18 mile walk and no rides til a Sheriff helped me out. Maybe an "lol 69" sign would work.

waited 18 hours 
people are paranoid
Took 8 hours in literal 100 degree heat to get a ride offer period, which took us up to the interstate. Sherriff was cool here.

Cops here are dicks, couldn't recite any specific law where hitchhiking was illegal between labored breaths, because they were morbidly obese and pushing 60.
The entire walk to the next town no one would pick us up. That's nearly 20 miles.

Atleast across the street here is a donut place with an open dumpster, so you can stock up before having to endure that all.

The last little bit of civilization here before New Mexico is a truck stop. Terrible place. One of the managers doesn't care what you do here, she and her husband house up transients. Due to the weird on-ramp you need a directional sign. Hard to get a ride east.

Love's Travel Center

No good for hitchhiking. Employees will run you off within and hour.  The truck stop is also VERY small so far.
Don't even consider trying here. It's totally pointless as no one hits the interstate at this entry.
Got stuck in Evanston for two days and had to buy a bus ticket to SLC to get out. Friendly locals and lots of kickdowns of food and cash but nobody would give me a ride from any ramps or truck stops.
While the road has got an average traffic, only a tiny fraction of cars are actually hitting the interstate. I gave up after 3 hours.

On certain parts of 101, such as this one, hitchhiking is illegal and someone will call the police, who will take you to a really dumb area that will be hard to get out of. I guess if you're on the on-ramps before the "no pedestrian" signs you're fine. Or if no one calls the fuzz on you.
Long wait, but a good ride - dudes who took me along on their Yellowstone explorations.

Cops here apparently don't know the laws regarding hitchhiking. To be safe, stay up on the grass at the very beginning of the on ramps. Took a day and some change to go east but I got picked up in my first RV, which broke down but who cares, RV, you know?

Hitching here sucks and is dangerous. 
On one exit just across the large adult store the cars are going too fast and the only rides you'll get is from creeps at the store (have your knives ready)

The other exit is slow so people have time to consider picking you up, but there's hardly any traffic and people in the area I'm told will not pick up hitchhikers. Waited here 2.5 days.

Between me and my road dawg, and another group of two with a female, we must have put in 15 hours here. Lots of old people driving by, quite a few middle fingers, and people just looking at us like we're crazy. Any exit's better than here.
Hardly any traffic. No rides even during the whole walk to the next town.
Terrible, terrible. One car / hour. Maybe a LITTLE more during rush hour.
Terrible spot. Lots of traffic and lots of funny looks but no rides.Cops will hassle you. Walk down a few exits there'll be a Walmart exit and an airport exit.
Horrible spot deswpite the traffic. Waited 5 hours in 80 degree weather before I got a pity ride to Portland. I've also been told Salem is a death wish, in terms of hitching.

This is supposedly the best exit for this town. Hardly any cars, people don't want to stop for you period. Didn't get ride a full day (10AM - 10:30PM) Finally next day someone took pity on me and drove me to Montana border. They said people have been stuck there 4 days before. Do not hitch here.
Fast traffic, no place to stop.  Dangerous to hitch here.

For I-95 N.  
Might be dangerous for cars to stop here.
A dangerous place to thumb.  Cars merge into the on-ramp here and sometimes drive onto the white stripes without looking.

WARNING, if you try to hitch right from the entrance of the national park, rangers will come and harass you and give you a ticket. We got into trouble only after waiting 10 minutes with an asshole, and in Yosemite we hitchhiked with Rangers!
Its senseless to try to hitchhike out of this upper-class neighbourhood, and in general out of this insanely massive urban city. Waited here almost 2 days.
crap place to hitch from

Horrible, horrible, horrible spot.  A trucker out of Tucson dropped me off here thinking he was helping me out with a great spot.  I was stuck here three nights before my friends drove out from San Antonio to pick me up.  Understandable though, you\\'re three miles away from Juarez.
No idea about hitching from here into Canada, though...

At the border crossing, the border guards didn't allow me to try to hitch into the US on the interstate, or to walk on it. They insisted (nicely and politely, I should say) that I had to take a taxi to the Irving fuel station that is about 5km further, which is a pretty good hitching spot. The taxi was 7$, and it turns out that crossing on a land border costs 6$ (as of October 2014).

Wanted to go West to Newark
Lots of beggars
bad position.
Bad place to hitch. Cars are passing by too fast to stop.
Cars travelling too fast here to stop or get a good look, would be dangerous to hitchhike here.
No one seemingly uses this on-ramp, so no chance of a lift.

I wouldn't suggest trying to hitch North/East on I-80 after noon.  Many many commuters, tons of people laugh at you, thinking you're destitute or joking, I don't know.  It was a terrible feeling so much that I decided to quit thumbing after a couple hours and walk to another spot.

There are too many bums on this on ramp begging for money.  Not a good spot to go north on Interstate 15.  Instead, take D Street to Barstow and hitch from the giant gas station (green point in Barstow).
Black Hole. Waiting time over 3 hours
Bus driver recommended the on-ramp near here, don't even try it unless you like getting stared at with no ride offers.

if you need to go to san Fran, there's a public library in sparks, with free internet connection, you canbuy a megabus ticket to san fran fro 14/17 dollars. It leaves everyday from the bus terminal in sparks at 10 am and at 3pm.
I got almost arrested here. For jaywalking and hitchiking. Cops in reno and sparks are the most bastard in america.
Waited all morning but nobody stopped. People go to reno to gamble, not to pick up hitchikers. Too hot under the sun and no shade.
impossible to get a ride here, people from the denver suburbs..
Do not expect a ride towards Mount Rushmore. No room to pull over, although you could strike up conversations at local fast food. Otherwise expect to walk.

Try not to get dropped off here if you are going West into Rapid City or else expect a LONG walk. I was dropped off here from a truck and walked into Box Elder- local traffic only. I was lucky and a mailman happened to give me a ride into Rapid City.
Horrible!  Avoid!  Highway patrol has a station nearby and will likely hassle you, plus there is a prison up the road.

Forget about it, people.  In my opinion, the access roads present a major problem for the viability of hitching.  People are already driving too fast, and there are no good shoulders.  I had to walk south on I-35 for a good ways, before I was able to hitch a ride out of the city.
Southbound. There is no place for cars to stop.

It was easy to get out off San Francisco Southbound hitchhiking on this spot! Downtown to Dali station with BART and from Dali with the bus to Pacifica. See the description on the point just hundred meters North off this one.  To not be bothered stand here, there is a lot of space for cars to pull over. Ride to S. Cruz in less than 10 min.
stuck here 3x days going east. no hitching on interstate.  best hike is up  hwy30.
Horrible, horrible place. I got skunked here and had to spend the night on the embankment. Walk back to the CA 33 and go to where it meets the I-5.

Tried to go south but only made it to Grover Beach a few miles down. I went to school there for 4 years and never saw any hitchers either. I was able to give a ride from Santa Barbara to SLO once and the guy found a ride immediately on the 1. I'd suggest that. I'm going to give it a try myself in a few.
Morro Bay is a beautiful spot but I had a terrible time trying to hitch there.  Drivers where extremely rude, flipping me off, yelling at me and taking pictures of me as they drove by!
Was stuck here two days and eventually got a Greyhound ticket to Rock Springs, WY just to get out of Utah.  I wish I\\'d seen this site then to know about that spot north of this one.
I was scared out of my mind by crazy people on meth on the highway outside of Eureka!  Two different nuts ran up to me to yell in my face!  It was frightening.
Rubbish. Absolutely pointless trying to hitch out of this one-horse town. After 5 hours, we took the bus instead.

We were told by law enforcement that hitchhiking is illegal throughout the whole of Michigan and forced to leave this spot. While this statement is questionable, you'd be better off walking, to the nearest great lake and then swimming to Canada. o_O Good luck, you'll need it.

Going North on the 101, sign said FLORENCE.

Don't thumb here, cross the bridge instead.

GOING TO BOISE

there is even a street sign that someone inscribed the back saying "THIS IS A BAD SPOT"   ... so I tried for 10 minutes but got a bad vibe, and I walked about 2 miles up Hwy 12
we got 86ed out of the entire county f nampa idaho just for sittin in a field but there are good mushies and rly cheap
stay away from here the cops would not leave us aone
You really, really, really don't want to get dropped here. However, if you do, and you're low on water, head to the fire station; they're nice.

There is room to stop, but people are driving too fast to bother giving a ride. Everyone leaving the hot springs were heading East.

Two siblings who passed me came back to pick me up. They told me they had a long way to Seattle, won't change much for them to give a ride. 
Very friendly, we talked about travel, family and wildlife. 
I exchanged with a bible for riders against a big knife.

Plenty of space to stop on the ramp and lots of traffic, but mostly ignored by people. 

Had finally after an hour and more a ride from a truck driver.
(the first one on this trip !)

We did a delivery together to Lewisville before he dropped me to pursue my trip. Great guy.

Almost NO CARS. 

I start walking towards Sipapu hoping to have more chance to get a ride from people skiing there, still turning on my sign to the cars passing by

A nice couple and their dog end up stopping and picked me up in the middle of nowhere and gave me a nice ride all the way to the Ashram in Taos

After 10 minutes, a Crowley cop showed up and told me to leave, as I wasn't allowed to hitchhike there or on any state highway
I politely told him I was, but he still wouldn't let me do. As I told him I had no other solution, he ended up telling me to walk on the service until the next Interstate exit.
Told me it would be a 20-30 min walk, so I accepted when I ended up walking 1h30. 

He definitely just wanted me out of his juridiction, cops are cops.

Tried to get a ride until night, between the ramp and directly on the highway shoulder.

Very low traffic, no one stopped. 
My CS host in Lafayette ended up coming to get me.

Clerk at the gulf gas station around very sympathic.

Awful spot, almost no traffic and closest gas station empty. Bad recommendation from a local. 

A very nice Mexican guy on his way home inland stopped a first time and I refused the ride as I was heading more South.
He came back and offered to drop me Downtown, which I eventually accepted.

Trying to get South, the location seemed good with nice traffic and plenty of room to pull over. Cops didn't bother.
However, only two cars who stopped by, one offering a ride 2 exits down the road and the other one to check if I need some money.

Got a crappy first WaffleHouse experiecne who didn't help. 
Wasn't in the mood of being on the road, I might not have the good aura that day for people to stop by.

I ended giving up and went back to where I stayed and decided to leave the city w

Got dropped the day before, close to nighttime. 
Tried to get a ride to keep heading South but couldn't get anyone, only people going North or locals.

At the Pilot gas station, they would let me ask for rides outside, but when I tried to set up a sign inside while having a snack, I got ask rudely to take it off. At AC&T, They threatened to call the cops. 
Most people I ask for rides were very nice tho.

End up spending the night in the woods.

In the morning, a local got me breakfast at
Got told by the state trooper if he saw me around the area hitchhiking again he'd take me to jail. Can't really argue with that ...

a lot of traffic, lots of rude drivers (middle fingers, yelling, etc). Ended up hitching here for 5 days before taking a bus to Champiagn (luckily very cheap with amtrak, I would recommend waiting for a good deal instead of wasting time trying to hitch here). Most police officers did not seem to care except for one who threatened to arrest me if he saw me again, but I ended up leaving the next day on a bus anyway. I don't think that's the norm, the other cops there have been relatively nice to m
I've been trying  to get a ride out of here. Came from Nevada. Bad spot for hitchhiking.

Tried this spot as it was recommended by the wiki. Extremely difficult to hitch to this spot, I ended up walking there from white river downtown (1 h ish)  Spent two hours, got nothing, ended up spending the night rough camping. Tried for an hour the next morning, ended up just walking back to white river and getting a hitch pretty quickly from downtown. I learned a lesson- take the wikis word with a grain of salt.
Local cop stopped, said it wasn't legal to hitch on the interstate. Took me to US 34 which is where my day ended more or less. Good camping in the wildlife management areas in Nebraska.

Terrible spot. Waited so many hours here before I got a ride 15 minutes down the road to the Loves, which seemed much more hospitable. Everybody here is going to Las Vegas so this is especially bad if you want to head to L.A or southern California
This spot must’ve been too good; it’s now illegal to hitchhike in the city of Pacifica. Rest of hwy 1 is still great though.
Long wait. Couldn't get a ride east or north. Hardly any traffic in either direction. Eventually a pickup stopped and took us to Londonderry.
Stupid hot,not one person stopped.. there's a bum that lives in a drain pipe that will get mad at you if you look at his spot for to long...

Horrible Horrible spot I have no idea how we got a ride. Pulled over with very little shoulder. Put us in the pickup bed all the way to Elizabethton, TN. Gave us ham sandwiches, pudding, Sun Chips, and Mountain Dew.
Bad spot. Cop told us it was illegal to Hitchhike and drove us to the county line.
Extremely dead stretch of I40 mixed with bad luck. Love the rolling hills though. Ride from an old guy who used to hitchhike.

spent 16 hours here flying a sign for nashville before I caved and caught a greyhound. i think most of the traffic is local and for whatever reason i didn't have any luck with trucks. there are a bunch of truck stops here though
25's. Hard to stop: hitching from the left, plus people have to go over the curb to stop, or to block the road.

Thumbed here for hours, maybe three or four. Sombebody eventually called the cops on me, cop came, was super friendly and said "Oh your're justo looking for a ride ? Good luck and be safe" He took my ID for check but nothing else. Waited a few more minutes and left. Highly recomment the other exit down south.
Spot disposition is good, except nobody comes there. Only few locals.

2ppl, 25's.The place seems good bcs there are a lot of restaurants and shops around, but NOBODY STOPPED. Worthless. We tried the two of us or only one, none was working. Only one local stopped to give a very short ride. Declined.

Very bad, there is room to stop but people are coming a bit fast, and more than that: NOBODY CARES. 2ppl here, waited for more than 2h with very good traffic, and nobody was picking us up. 
We tried a bit with our "Austin" sign but it didn't help.

VERY BAD, ppl here are afrait of hithickers (and we were pretty clean cutted), we had more ppl giving us money than rides, and even more middle fingers. 
Tried on the ramp when it was getting dark, no success, at the gas station up north, no success, tried in the morning at both spots at the same time (we were two) and finally got picked up at the gas station, guy was nice, but it was really a pitty ride. Used thumb or sign, depends

VERY BAD SPOT. Those on ramps are very bad because cars go too fast on them. Not possible for them to stop. 
2 ppl, Tried to ask at the flying G, no succes, finally hitched north and got picked up in the back of a pickup truc in 5 min. But that ride ended up worth nothing
Only a few people stopped but didn't went west. Somebody called the police on me (but they where very friendly). After 3 h a nice lady from the neighbourhood picked me up and let me stay at her place
Only locals, only one person stopped for a short ride. Bad
Nobody stops. Ultimately a truck driver from Tajikistan took us 2 exists further. Worthless.
Trecherous place, the magnitudes were cold. Forced overnight in winter.  Towns folk even called the police.
We waited forever and finally got a very short ride. Not good even if there is good visibility and space to stop

Not a very good spot, not a lot of traffic, plus I was going a non usual route, so I got picked up by the owner of the store I was standing in front of. He brought me to a better spot to hitch to Atlanta, right before Blue Ridge
Not a good hitchhiking spot to Phoenix. You might have better luck going further up the road. A lot of people will give you the stare and not pick you up.
Very bad spot, had to beg a local to take me down an exit to the truck stop. Don't stop here, go south one further

Lexington SUCKS. Avoid this place. Many bums and addicts make locals suspicious of travelers. It is hard to sleep safely, hard to hitch out of, no truck stops in the city. really really bad (and I am clean cut...)

Boerne Police will tell you to leave. They were not friendly about it either. I ended up catching a ride from a County Deputy who dropped me off in the next county. (I was walking on the side of the interstate after the local police told me to stop asking for rides; just had my thumb out on an on ramp.)
almost dead. so many people just shim me the fuck gesture and that’s it. better to take a bus (i’m a white young fella)
Tried 1h before deciding to the take the the bustang west. Worth its price...
Seems like a good spot : visibility speed and place but I got nothing in an 1h30.
Waited an hour before moving and didn't get anything. People mostly go to the dollar store
Dead zone. Was on this spot and whole road for a ~3 hours and no one picked me up. So I went to Smithfield only with my legs. (I'm so tired bc of my backpack ;()
Waited all day and nothing - met another really great hitched though. Truckers were being arseholes too

Not a good place to get picked up. Absolute freak on way to parole meeting picked me up, worst hitch of my life. Won't go into detail but very sexual and I feared for my life. Luckily he had a shitty old car and it was a really hot day (July) so he pulled up to the Cullman County rest area to cool the engine in the shade and I jumped the fuck out.
Absolutely ass spot - cops coming along all the time, including KSU campus cops, very little shade, and the lights aren't red for very long

I flew right in front of the truck exit and didn't get a ride after over 4 hours. Most truckers here are either going west, or can't pick up hitch hikers because of their insurance/company policy. Got cash kick downs, but no ride offers. Another hitcher was flying at the i80 east on-ramp and was there as long as I was with no luck. In the future I'd just forgo this spot entirely.
Really nobody was stopping.

Avoid getting dropped in Weed if you can. This town doesn't live up to it's namesake. 
The locals aren't likely to offer a ride and most through traffic is going up hwy 97. You're still in for a long wait, but this ramp is slightly more likely to see through traffic than the other one.

This town definitely doesn't live up to it's name. Do what you can to avoid being dropped here, if you're heading north on I-5. You'll be waiting for a long time.

The people here suck too. There wasn't as much hostility, but there were a bunch of hotrods that rolled past revving their engines. On top of that there isn't a lot of traffic on the ramp and most of it was teslas and BMWs.

It sounds like there is a bus that heads out to the town of woodland. That's probably your best bet heading north on I-5.

I was prodded along after only 15 minutes. The ramp was admittedly, a little tricky but there was tons of room for traffic to pull off.
